SEARCH
Package mru.game.controller

Class GameManager

java.lang.Object
mru.game.controller.GameManager
public class GameManager extends Object
This class Manages the loading and saving of the data as well as calls to run to start the game
Author:
Haseeb, Lorenzo, Alex

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private final int
    INITIAL_BAL
    This is the initial balance of NEW players that are not in the database
    private final int
    INITIAL_WIN
    This is the initial win of NEW players that are not in the database new players should not have any wins in our database
    private AppMenu
    menu
     
    private final String
    PLAYER_DATABASE_FILE
    This Final Variable holds the path for to the database
    private ArrayList<Player>
    playersArrayList
    This ArrayList Holds a list of Player Objects saved in the database

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameManager()
    This constructor initiates the AppMenu and the ArrayList and calls methods to load the saved data and start the game

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    private Player
    askUserName()
    This method calls to asks the name of the current player, if the current player is a returning player then it will call a method that greets the player.
    private Player
    createNewUser(String newPlayerName)
    This method creates a new Player object by initializing a new Player object with the initial balance and win value
    private void
    loadFile()
    This Method loads the file into the playerArrayList by reading and splitting the PLAYER_DATABASE_FILE using delimiter of ","
    private void
    playGame(Player userName)
    This method initializes the BlakcjackGame class and starts the blackjack game
    private void
    save()
    This method saves the data of the players after playing the game into the database text file and formats it as "name,balance,numberOfWins"
    private void
    searchForName()
    This method calls to validate a searched name, if the name is valid then a method is called that displays the player information, and if the name is invalid it calls a method that displays an invalid message
    private Player
    searchNameValidation(String playerName)
    This method validate a players name by using a for loop to compare if the playerName is the same as any of the name in the playersArrayList
    private void
    searchPlayerMenu()
    This Method calls a sub menu that allows the user to choose a way to search for a player
    private void
    searchTop()
    This method sorts the player with the most number of wins in descending order and calls another method to display it If there are no players to compare to, then call a method to display an indication of this
    private void
    startGame()
    This Method Starts the game and calls for to prompt the main menu that loops until the user chooses to exit

  • Constructor Details

    • GameManager

      public GameManager() throws IOException
      This constructor initiates the AppMenu and the ArrayList and calls methods to load the saved data and start the game
      Throws:
      IOException

  • Method Details

    • loadFile

      private void loadFile() throws IOException
      This Method loads the file into the playerArrayList by reading and splitting the PLAYER_DATABASE_FILE using delimiter of ","
      Throws:
      IOException - if there's an issue with reading the file

    • startGame

      private void startGame() throws IOException
      This Method Starts the game and calls for to prompt the main menu that loops until the user chooses to exit
      Throws:
      IOException - if there's an issue with reading the file

    • searchPlayerMenu

      private void searchPlayerMenu()
      This Method calls a sub menu that allows the user to choose a way to search for a player

    • searchForName

      private void searchForName()
      This method calls to validate a searched name, if the name is valid then a method is called that displays the player information, and if the name is invalid it calls a method that displays an invalid message

    • askUserName

      private Player askUserName()
      This method calls to asks the name of the current player, if the current player is a returning player then it will call a method that greets the player. If the current player is a new player, then it will create a new player object and add it into the playerArrayList
      Returns:
      returns the new or returning player object

    • createNewUser

      private Player createNewUser(String newPlayerName)
      This method creates a new Player object by initializing a new Player object with the initial balance and win value
      Parameters:
      newPlayerName - the Players name that was not found in the database
      Returns:
      returns the new player object

    • playGame

      private void playGame(Player userName)
      This method initializes the BlakcjackGame class and starts the blackjack game
      Parameters:
      userName - the current player playing

    • searchNameValidation

      private Player searchNameValidation(String playerName)
      This method validate a players name by using a for loop to compare if the playerName is the same as any of the name in the playersArrayList
      Parameters:
      playerName - any player name as long as its a string
      Returns:
      returns the Player object found, or if the player is not found in the ArrayList then returns null

    • searchTop

      private void searchTop()
      This method sorts the player with the most number of wins in descending order and calls another method to display it If there are no players to compare to, then call a method to display an indication of this

    • save

      private void save() throws IOException
      This method saves the data of the players after playing the game into the database text file and formats it as "name,balance,numberOfWins"
      Throws:
      IOException - if there's an issue with writing to the PLAYER_DATABASE_FILE
